Hedonic Pricing by using AI
- Amazon has to keep track of all the trends to have a relevant stock and cost options for huge number of products.
- Challenges

- Train the model on data from one year.

AI Definition and Its Underlying Philosophy

Deep-rooted Human-centric Thinking

- Desire to regard HI as something special
- To show how AI machines can't do some of the things that huma brains do
    - Evidence used to prove how much HI is better than AI?
- How much should we put a logical weight on the argument that the human way of doing things is the best way?
Weak AI
- Minsky's definition of AI
    Machines do things that appear to be intelligent acts
- Weak AI
    The probability that machines can act intelligently as a human does or act as if they were intelligent as a human
Strong AI
- The possibility that a machine can *actually* think in the same way as a human, as opposed to appearing to simulate human thinking
- It would be possible to build a computer that *completely* replicated the functioning of the human brain in *every aspect.* -> Singularity
Computationalism으로 인간 보기
- Philosophy of Mind
- Computationalism
    - the human mind is an information processing system 
    - thinking is a form of computing
- Computationalism argues that the reliationship between mind and body is similar or identical to the relationship between software and hardwrare
    Q. Do you agree with this argument? Can you seggest rational reasons for your answer?
&Modern AI
- AI refers to *computational tools* that are able to *substitute* for HI in the performance of certain tasks.
    Core mechanism driving current dazzling success of many companies around the world
- Examples in marketing

    - How to apply AI to customer segmentation(고객세분화)
    - How to use AI to establish relationship with customers on their terms

DL

Deep Learning (a.k.a representation learning) seeks to learn rich hierarchical representations(i.e. features) automatically through multiple stage of feature learning process.

CNN

  • Input of Convolutional Neural Network can have very high dimension. Using a fully-connected neural network would need a large amount of parameters.
  • Inspired by the neurophysiological experiments conducted by [Hubel&Wiesel 1962], CNNs are a special type of neural network whose hidden units are only connected to local receptive field.
    • The number of parameters needed by CNNs is much smaller.

Cognition biases

Halo effect & Horn effect

: Your overall impression of a person influences how you feel and think about their character. This especially applies to physical attractiveness influencing how you rate their other qualities.
SO, RESPECT OTHERS

Dunning-Kruger effect

: When people who believe that they are smarter and more capable than they really are

Self-serving bias

: Tendency to blame external forces when bad things happen and give yourself credit when good things happen.

Misinformation effect

: Tendency for post-event information to interfere with the memory of the original event
It is easy to have you memory influenced by what you hear about the event from others. Knowledge of this effect has led to a mistrust of eyewitness informations.

Anchoring bias

: Tendency to rely too heavily on the very first piece of information you learn
If you learn the average piece for a car is a certain value, you will think any amout below that is a good deal, perhaps not searching for better deals.

Actor-observer bias

: Tendency to attribute your own actions to external causes while attributing other people’s behaviors to internal causes.
For examples, you attribute your high cholesterol level to genetics while you consider others to have a high level due to poor diet and lack of exercise.

Availability heuristic

: Tendency to place greater value on information that comes to your mind quickly
You give greater credence to this information and tend to overestimate the probability and likelihood of similar things happening in the future

Conformation bias

: Tendency to favor information that conforms to your existing beliefs and discounting evidence that does not conform.
